intro: Adenocarpus aureus, commonly known as the golden burr, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and distinctive, spiny pods that enclose its seeds. It typically grows in grassland and savanna habitats, often in well-drained soils. Adenocarpus aureus is used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
